website_summaries.verdict: With impressive performance for its size and long battery life, the Asus ZenBook 13 UX331UN is hard to pass up for the price if you want a travel-friendly laptop for school or business.
pros: The 13.3-inch Asus ZenBook 13 UX331UN delivers overall excellent performance from its eighth-gen Intel processor and discrete Nvidia graphics chip
All in a slim, lightweight and attractive package
cons: The glossy body is impossible to keep clean of fingerprints, its USB-C port isn't Thunderbolt 3 and can't be used to charge the laptop, and its keyboard doesn't deliver the best typing experience

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good battery life, small form factor and MX150 graphic video card make this the perfect laptop for school or work. It does attract fingerprints fairly easily, but it is difficult to complain at the sub 1000$ price point.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Tremblay-Darveau

customer_reviews.title: One of the best laptops in the market
customer_reviews.text: This is undoubtly one of the best laptops you'll get for this price range. I am a college student who likes to watch movies and tv shows, but also needs a device that can stay alive during a day of classes. This laptop has been perfect for me, as its battery lasts for several hours (using Google drive and other websites simoutaneously) and it is not heavy at all. I sometimes forget it's in my backpack, that's how light it is! Everything is working beautifully, haven't had a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: Luiza Dias

customer_reviews.title: ok laptop except the speakers...
customer_reviews.text: my phone is louder than the speakers on this thing and cant seem to find a fix for it anywhere online...
customer_reviews.author: mikeymontz

customer_reviews.title: Ultra portable that ALSO plays current games? WHAT?!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: + Beautiful design + lightweight + bright screen + better than avg speakers + excellent battery life + 8th gen processor with 4 cores + plays last gen & less demanding games at 1080p/high and current gen at lower settings Cons (minor really): - fingerprint magnet (top of it) - Kind of noisy under full load (when mx150 is in use) - slight coil whine, but this doesn't bother me - not as future proof without thunderbolt and upgradable ram
customer_reviews.author: linari

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable laptop
customer_reviews.text: Had to return item. System crashed. In the middle of work and got a blank screen. It's unfortunate. ASUS need to improve quality control. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jose S. Bautista

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I loved this laptop lightweight, thin vessels, and much more this also makes a great gaming laptop
customer_reviews.author: Urmila Shrestha

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this laptop for university and it fulfills all my needs. Great device would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Amazon referb computes have really fallen off in quality.
customer_reviews.text: Are other people having the same problems with Amazon refurbs? It used to be a good way to save some money on a computer - now they seem to be sending out garbage. This is a nice laptop. The graphics chip is very good for a small machine. The problem was that mine did not have keyboard lighting and the screen flickered. I can't imagine it was checked at all the problems were so obvious. I'll save a week and buy a new machine from now on - perhaps that was the whole point.
customer_reviews.author: Tom from New Haven

customer_reviews.title: Got sent the wrong laptop, and when they sent the right one, it didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and the laptop that was sent over WAS NOT the laptop I bought, and was in fact a cheaper model valued at less than half the price. After sending that model back and asking for the correct model, I was sent the beautiful pristine laptop I actually wanted. Unfortunately, the laptop didn’t work: the entire pc froze up less than two hours after I started using it, and the freezing got progressively more frequent to the point that it couldn’t make it past boot up. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Terrible computer
customer_reviews.text: The trackpad is awful. Freezes up and sticks every couple seconds. It’s so bad that it’s impossibke to get anything done on the computer. It’s just not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard broke after about a year. Right after the warranty expired of coarse. Otherwise a nice laptop but my daughter will no longer use it due to multiple keys not working. So now I need to spend a bunch to get it fixed or buy a new laptop. Asus build a better product please.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Leslie

customer_reviews.title: The Speakers  blew out
customer_reviews.text: After having this computer for a while, one speaker blew out, and the other followed. I never did anything more than watch videos, and it was very well taken care of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: COIL WHINE!
customer_reviews.text: 1st thing, this laptop has coil whine. 2nd, the trackpad feel really cheap for a thousand dollar device. 3rd the screen is not stable, it move too much when you use the touchscreen.
customer_reviews.author: Ayeron

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop with very thin and light design and also strong processor and MX150.
customer_reviews.author: Kiano!

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is faulty
customer_reviews.text: Within the first moments of using this laptop, I had two keys just pop off. They are only held on to the laptop with extremely fragile little plastic pieces. There is no reason to buy a laptop with such a horrible design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Akers

customer_reviews.title: Nearly there, yet so far
customer_reviews.text: This is almost there being the ideal laptop , except one flaw makes it unusable. The 8 GB ram is far too less for any professional use, its a big no no. I wish they could have just put in socketed ram that could have atlest been upgraded. Now for improvements. You should have a model with not touch screen. This will improve the battery life by 25%. And drop the glossy body. With this there will not be a laptop to beat in the market.
customer_reviews.author: agsn

product_meta.title: Asus ZenBook 13 UX331UN-WS51T Ultra-Slim Laptop 13.3” FHD Touch Display, 8th Gen Intel Core i5 Processor, 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD, NVIDIA MX150, Windows 10, Backlit Kbd, Fingerprint
product_meta.description: Style:2018 VersionIntel Core i5-8250U Processor 1.6 GHz (6M Cache, up to 3.4 GHz), 13.3" Fhd wide view display, NVIDIA GeForce MX150 2GB, 8GB LPDDR3 RAM, 256GB M.2 SSD, USB 3.1 Type-C (Gen1), USB 3.0, HDMI, 802.11AC Dual-Band Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.2, fingerprint Reader, illuminated Chicklet Keyboard. The actual transfer speed of USB 3.0, 3.1 (Gen 1 and 2), and/or Type-C will vary depending on many factors including the processing speed of the host device, file attributes and other factors related to system configuration and your operating environment.
feature_bullets: 13.3-Inch wide-view Full-HD nano-edge bezel touch display in 13.3” chassis with Windows 10 Pre-installed;WebCam : VGA Web Camera
Latest 8th generation Intel i5-8250U 1.6 GHz Processor (Turbo to 3.4 GHz)
Fast storage and memory featuring 256GB SATA SSD with 8GB DDR3 RAM and NVIDIA Geforce MX150
Extensive connectivity with HDMI/USB Type C, 802.11a/c WiFi, and micro SD Card Reader
Built-in fingerprint reader with one-touch login via Windows Hello feature
